meanings.definition: To express a thought or idea concisely and effectively.
meanings.sent1: She always aphorises her beliefs to make them clear.
meanings.sent2: He tends to aphorise his opinions to avoid confusion.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to aphorise their essays for better understanding.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to aphorise complex concepts amazed her classmates.
meanings.sent5: In order to remember the key points, try to aphorise them in a few words.

meanings.definition: To make a concise statement or observation.
meanings.sent1: He will aphorise his findings in the report.
meanings.sent2: The poet likes to aphorise his emotions in his poems.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to aphorise the situation, but it only made things funnier.
meanings.sent4: She aphorised the problem as a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: To make your point clear, aphorise it in a single sentence.
